sub_title: Technical Medical Doctor at Thorax Centrum Twente / Assistant Professor at University of Twente

awards.title: Pioneers in Healthcare Grant 2017
awards.description:
Electro-mechanical resynchronisation therapy with a smart material for patients with heart failure

In order to support the failing heart, in 2017 we demonstrated a proof of principle by sending an electrical signal through a smart material to improve the heart’s pump function. 
With this research we aim at a proof-of concept of electro-mechanical resynchronization therapy and bring this therapy closer to patientcare. 
We apply shape-memory alloys around a failing heart (model) and use experts from UT (materials science), MST (cardio-thoracic surgery), ZGT(cardiology, heart failure) and Saxion (ambient intelligence, smart materials). 
Shape-memory alloys are tested in different designs and in increasing complex heart models with a goal to improve contractility of the heart.

awards.title: Best Poster Award DSSH
awards.description: A Human Factors Perspective on Simulation-Based Surgical Skill Assessment: Poster Presentation at the Annual Conference of the Dutch Society for Simulation in Healthcare (DSSH), March 16th 2016, Delft, the Netherlands. profile_positions.description:
at TechMed Centre, Dept. of Biomechanical Engineering

Director of Cardiac Surgery Innovations Lab

Research topics include:
- Minimally invasive cardiac surgery
- Technological innovations in cardio-thoracic surgery with Surgical Technology Assessment
- Simulation-based learning for (continous) medical education
- Cardiac (p)rehabilitation and personalised recovery
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
In a collaboration project between Thorax Centrum Twente (Medisch Spectrum Twente) and University of Twente, clinical research focuses at innovations in cardio-thoracic surgery.
Doctoral research was conducted from 2014-2020.

Several Quality Improvement Projects in cardiology, cardio-thoracic surgery and lung surgery.

Supervisor of several student projects at Thorax Centrum Twente, University of Twente, Radboud University, Utrecht University, and University of Groningen.

Project Manager "Nederlandse Hart Registratie".

Supervisors doctoral research: prof. J. Grandjean MD, PhD, FETCS, prof. H.F.J.M. Koopman, PhD

Skills and training:
- Good Clinical Practice
- Teaching and Supervising Skills
- Teach the Teacher
- Data Management
- Yellow Belt Lean Six Sigma
